answers.answer: Try napping in your bedroom with the shades drawn.  This doesn't sound 'bad' to me, more like a psychovisual phenomenon of someone who is still 'awake' when the vision part of the brain is just going to sleep.  Definitely not stroke-like.  I can see no connection to the ears or the diabetes.  Unusual complaint.  If it starts to happen while you're awake and upright call your PCP and your ophthalmologist both.

question: Lately if I decide to snooze during the day (doesn't happen at night) and I lie on the couch, just before I go to sleep I am jolted awake by a field of color (red or green so far) while my eyes are CLOSED.  It is suddenly and scary.  My recent history:  just began insulin for diabetes, just had two cataract surgeries (had floaters and flashes for awhile, but not now), had right ear surgery several years ago (to remove huge amt of scar tissue which came back), then same doc cleaned out right ear two months ago so I could hear a bit better, so I now get whooshing sounds in my head (no ringing) and wonder if there is a connection between that sound and the color flashes when eyes closed.  Both make me feel weird, to say the least.  I feel like I am going to have a stroke.
title: Seeing colors when eyes closed
